title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Petit Bourgeois Rosé de Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)
description: This is a tangy fruity wine. It has crisp acidity along with spice as well as red-currant fruitiness. It is light and refreshing and ready to drink now.

title: Early Mountain 2014 Eluvium Red (Virginia)
description: This wine is bright with cherry and incense aromas. Cherry and bramble flavors are juicy and fresh, with support from supersoft tannins and zippy acidity. This makes for an easy drinking summer red.

title: Le Val 2016 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)
description: This is a well-balanced and approachable rosé, with pretty tones of fresh peony and strawberry tops, grounded by fruitier notes of watermelon and white currant. The palate is light and zippy with acidity, its short, clean finish carrying an impression of lime zest. Drink now.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Weinkellerei Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)
description: Earthy slightly herbaceous tones juxtapose sweet peach and citrus in this straightforward easy-drinking Spätlese. It's delicate in concentration but juicy, finishing pleasantly brisk

title: Les Alliés 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: This wine has a fine structure, with some dusty tannins and fresh acidity that keep its black currant fruit crisp. The aftertaste is rich and packed with fruitiness.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A hearty addition of 16% Semillon is in this white, which is floral with peach and apricot. Fleshy plushness dominates alongside a simple layering of acidity that keeps it balanced, taking on further fruit components of tropical pineapple and mango.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: The latest vintage of this popular brand continues the same ripe, soft character as before. Red berry fruits, balanced acidity and a rounded aftertaste all contribute to a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Jax 2015 Y3 Taureau Red (Napa Valley)
description: This rendition of half Merlot with smaller amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Zinfandel is moderate in structure and ripe in plum and dark cherry. Soft and smooth, it's an easy wine to share and enjoy in its simplicity.

title: Joseph Carr 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Simple, with a robust midpalate, this likable approachable wine captures bold flavors of juicy blueberry and black cherry within a framework of toasted oak and broad tannins. The finish is lengthy and full of spice.

title: McManis 2016 Viognier (River Junction)
description: Good ripe-pear and apple notes and touches of vanilla and almond lend a lot of flavor to this full-bodied wine. The texture is pleasantly soft, so it's easy to drink, and the price is hard to beat.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)
description: Ripe fruit and dark-chocolate flavors mark out this concentrated wine. Intense flavors bring out the black plum and damson fruit and heavy tannins that lie behind. Drink the wine from 2018.

title: Ampelos 2014 Ampelos Vineyard Syrache Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Made from 67% Syrah and 33% Grenache, this is a thick wine with a straightforward approach to its burly flavors of dark chocolate and compressed wild berry. Touches of garrigue and white pepper slither through the midpalate.

title: Benessere 2014 Collins Holystone Vineyard Aglianico (St. Helena)
description: This is, by the producer's own admission, the only varietal wine of its type in the Napa Valley, and it's 100% varietal to boot. Dried fruit and deli meat give it an Old-World edge that veers into prune-like overripeness to the uninitiated. It begs for food.

title: Valle Austral 2016 Selección Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Saucy plum and cherry aromas are respectable but unsophisticated. This Malbec feels full and rugged, with hard tannins. Generic berry flavors include a note of prune, while this tastes herbal and slightly chocolaty on the finish.

title: Villadoria 2016 Furèt  (Dolcetto d'Alba)
description: This informal red shows subdued iris and baking spice aromas. It's easygoing on the palate, with raspberry fruit, a bitter almond note and smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)
description: This wine has a lively, open and fruity side that promises plenty of good barbecues. Red fruits and acidity lie easily together. Drink now.

title: Cinnabar 2016 Rosé (California)
description: Tasting very ripe and a touch sweet, this deep pink wine smells like melons, tastes like cherry jam and feels smooth and soft on the palate.

title: Coelho 2016 Coelho Estates Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: One of the producer's three different rosés, this was also made using the saignée method. Its light strawberry and watermelon fruit flavors come through, with ample orange- and citrus-like acidity.

title: Dauntless 2015 No Man's Land Wädenswil Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A reductive note of rubber tire threads through the mélange of cherry cola, iron ore and red licorice flavors in this wine. The components have not yet integrated, leading to a finish marked by bitter skin and tannins. Give it another couple of years of bottle age before pulling the cork.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Vega Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a ripe wine with soft tannins and juicy black fruits. It has a good balance between the fruit and the structure, making it a wine for early, easy, beside-the-barbecue drinking.

title: Cairnbrae 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Fully mature, this light-bodied Pinot should be consumed before the end of 2017. Scents of cola and earth add interest to cherry fruit, ending with lingering acids.

title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Terra Santa White (Ile de Beauté)
description: This is a delicately perfumed wine that packs a punch of refreshing fruitiness. It has intense, crisp acidity and ripe apricot and lemon flavors. It's textured and ready to drink.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

title: Socré 2014  Barbaresco
description: Stewed prune aromas carry over to the palate, along with raw sour cherry, camphor and espresso notes. It's a tight and astringent wine with bracing tannins.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2015 Uncaged Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Jammy aromas and flavors that are as rich as maple syrup give a sweet accent to this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. It has a touch of tannin for grip and finishes on the sweet side.

title: Thibault 2015 Domaine de Villargeau Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: The wine, from the area north of Pouilly-Fumé, is brightly lit with fine acidity and green fruits. It is also textured, bringing out the chalk and flint soil of the areas. Drink this fruity lightly structured wine now.

title: Quevedo 2015 Oscar's Red Red (Douro)
description: Ripe and spicy, this is an obviously wood-aged wine. Spice and toastiness still dominate, although in a few months the potential of the juicy black fruits should become apparent. Wait to drink this wine until 2018.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: Ripe and juicy, this is a warm version of Touriga Nacional. Acidity and a smoky character balance the crushed blackberry fruitiness. Drink the wine now.

title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Ardósia Rosado Rosado (Tejo)
description: A crisp, fruity blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, this wine is bright and light. Its refreshing acidity and red-currant fruits are delicious to drink now.

title: Peter Mertes 2015 Platinum Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)
description: This off-dry white blend offers primary stone-fruit and tangerine flavors in a brisk light-footed package. It's harmoniously sweet with a slightly earthy dusty finish. Drink now.

title: Twill 2013 Syrah (Oregon)
description: Quite tannic, this hits hard with char, burnt rubber and espresso flavors, some black fruit just showing through. Best to drink up by 2018.
